bestBHT.bht: The Holy City is adorned with the glory of God, not merely a divine brightness, but with God Himself dwelling within. This luminary light, clear as crystal, shines from within the city, serving as a witness to Christ. It illuminates the surroundings like the sun or the stars, reflecting the radiant presence of the Heavenly Lamb. As believers, we anticipate a future state where our souls will be clothed in Christ's righteousness and we will experience the complete revelation of God's glory in us.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Having the glory of God—not merely the Shekinah-cloud, but God Himself as her glory dwelling in the midst of her."
her light—Greek, 'light-giver': properly applied to the heavenly luminaries which diffuse light.
Albert Barnes: Having the glory of God - A glory or splendor such as became the dwelling place of God.
And her light - In Revelation 21:23 it is said that 'the glory of God did lighten it.' That is, it was made light by the visible symbol of the Deity.
Clear as crystal - Pellucid or resplendent like crystal.
Marvin Vincent: Glory of God. Not merely divine brightness, but the presence of the God of glory Himself.
Light [φωστηρ] . Strictly, luminary; that with which the city is illumined, tlle heavenly Lamb.
Clear as crystal [κρυσταλλιζοντι] . Lit., shining like crystal.
Philip Schaff: The description of the city begins, and first she is spoken of as having the glory of God. This light lightens her both within and without.
From the subsequent description it appears that the idea of the Holy of Holies is in the Seer’s mind.
The word of the original translated 'light' is rather light-bearer or light-giver, and it refers to the light which the city sheds everywhere around her like the sun or the stars of heaven.
Archibald T. Robertson: God's very presence is in the Holy City (the Bride).
Christ is the light (φως) of the world and so are Christians who have received the illumination (φωτισμος) of God in the face of Christ and who radiate it to men.
The 'luminary' of the Holy City is her witness to Christ.
John Gill: Not only upon their souls, which will lie in the glorious robe of Christ's righteousness, the bride's wedding garment being on them, in the perfect holiness which will be in them, and in that complete knowledge of all spiritual and heavenly things they will be possessed of, they will have a glory revealed in them."

the presence of God may be intended by his glory, as the Shechinah, or the divine majesty of God in the tabernacle and temple was called, Exodus 40:35 1 Kings 8:11 for the glorious presence of God will now be in this church state, which will cast a lustre on all that are in it.
he is so now to them that believe, in his person, offices, grace, and righteousness, and will be more so in his light and glory in the new Jerusalem state.
John Wesley: Having the glory of God — For her light.
The light did not come in from without through this for the glory of God is within the city.
But it shines out from within to a great distance.

bhtAttempts.bht: The Holy City, as described in Revelation 21:11, is a radiant and magnificent place, having the very presence and glory of God dwelling in her midst. This glory is not simply a divine brightness, but the manifestation of the God of glory Himself. The city is illuminated by the heavenly Lamb, shining with a crystalline brightness like jasper. Its light shines from within, like a luminary, radiating the witness to Christ. This description gives a glimpse of the future state of believers, where the glory of God will be revealed in them and the presence of God will be in their midst, casting a luminous splendor on all.

The Holy City, having the glory of God, is not just filled with divine brightness, but with the presence of God Himself dwelling in her midst. The city's light emanates from the heavenly Lamb, illuminating it with a watery crystalline brightness, resembling jasper. This light is not external but shines out from within, serving as a witness to Christ. In this glorious state, believers will experience a revelation of God's glory in them and His presence amongst them, casting a radiant splendor on all.

The Holy City possesses the glory of God, the divine luminosity radiating from the presence of God Himself dwelling within. This light, reminiscent of watery crystalline brightness like jasper, is not an external source but rather a luminary shining from within. As believers, we are called to be light-bearers, reflecting the illuminating presence of Christ to the world. This description gives us a glimpse of the future state where believers will experience the complete manifestation of God's glory and dwell in His luminous presence.

The Holy City in Revelation 21:11 is adorned with the glory of God, not merely a divine brightness, but with God Himself dwelling in her midst. This radiance is not an external light, but a luminary shining from within, illuminating the city with a watery crystalline brightness like jasper. As believers, we are called to be witnesses to Christ, reflecting His light and radiating His presence to the world. This portrayal provides a glimpse of the future state where believers will experience the full revelation of God's glory and dwell in His luminous presence.

The Holy City is adorned with the glory of God, not merely a divine brightness, but with God Himself dwelling within. This luminary light, clear as crystal, shines from within the city, serving as a witness to Christ. It illuminates the surroundings like the sun or the stars, reflecting the radiant presence of the Heavenly Lamb. As believers, we anticipate a future state where our souls will be clothed in Christ's righteousness and we will experience the complete revelation of God's glory in us.
